column4: UPDATE 1-Orange says will remain in Belgium as consolidation brews

column4: U.S. judge picks lead plaintiff for Petrobras class-action suit

column4: Petrobras to seek $19 bln in financing despite downgrade -source
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  March 4 Brazil's Petroleo Brasileiro SA will seek financing of as much as $19 billion this year despite a corruption scandal that cost the state-run oil company its investment grade rating  a source with direct knowledge of the situation told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Petrobras scandal takes Brazilian politicians to Supreme Court
column5: BRASILIA  March 3 Brazil's top prosecutor asked the Federal Supreme Court on Tuesday to open investigations into politicians who allegedly benefited from a multibillion-dollar kickback scheme at state-run oil company Petrobras  a court official said on Tuesday.

column4: Environmentalists file suit over California oil refinery project
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Environmentalists in California filed a lawsuit on Wednesday against Contra Costa County over its approval last month of a plan to increase propane recovery at Phillips 66’s Rodeo refinery  saying the environmental review did not take into account the broader impact of the project.

column5: SYDNEY  March 4 Australia's Bengalla coal mine has been cleared to boost output by a third and operate for another two decades  majority owner Rio Tinto   said on Wednesday.

column4: RBS boss says no number set for 'significant' investment bank job cuts
column5: LONDON Royal Bank of Scotland  has yet to decide how many jobs it will cut at its investment bank after announcing a major downsizing of the business last week  its Chief Executive Ross McEwan said on Tuesday.

column4: RBS transforms Goodwin's old office into hub for new businesses
column5: LONDON  March 4 Royal Bank of Scotland has transformed the executive wing of its headquarters near Edinburgh  synonymous with the excesses of former CEO Fred Goodwin  into a hub for start-up businesses  as part of the bailed-out bank's bid to revive its reputation.

column4: Total eyes closing nine units located in tax havens by 2017
column5: PARIS French oil major Total disclosed a list of all its 903 subsidiaries worldwide in a transparency move on Wednesday after recurring criticism about the group's presence in tax havens.

column4: Spirit Aerosystems CEO says share buy backs are priority for cash use
column5: NEW YORK  March 4 Share buy backs are "top of the list" for returning cash to shareholders  Spirit Aerosystems Holdings Inc's chief executive officer told an investor conference on Wednesday.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Target to cut thousands of jobs as seeks to cut costs by $2 bln
column5: March 3 U.S. retailer Target Corp  which has been battling back after a massive data breach and sluggish performance  on Tuesday said it will eliminate several thousand jobs  mainly from headquarters locations in the United States and India  as it aims to cut $2 billion in costs over two years.

column4: DuPont rejects activist request to change how directors are elected
column5: DuPont  on Tuesday rejected a push to let shareholders split their votes between company-backed directors and those nominated by activist investors in an escalating proxy battle with Nelson Peltz.

column4: 'Over the counter' birth control pills might save public money
column5: (Reuters Health) - Providing no- or low-cost birth control pills over the counter may reduce costs and prevent up to a quarter of unplanned pregnancies  researchers say.

column4: Swatch Group says arbitration decision against Tiffany set aside
column5: ZURICH  March 4 Swiss watchmaker Swatch  said on Wednesday that an arbitration ruling in its case against U.S. jeweler Tiffany & Co from December 2013 was set aside by an Amsterdam court.

column4: UPDATE 1-Toyota promotes foreigners  including first woman  to top posts

column4: Toyota promotes foreigners  including woman  to top posts
column5: TOKYO  March 4 Toyota Motor Corp said on Wednesday it will promote two foreigners to senior posts - one marking the first woman to hold an executive title - in a drive towards diversifying its management  long dominated by Japanese men.

column4: Australia new vehicle sales set a record for Feb-VFACTS
column5: SYDNEY  March 4 Sales of new vehicles in Australia enjoyed their strongest February on record as demand for sports utilities turned red-hot  a promising sign that lower fuel prices and falling interest rates were supporting consumer spending.

column4: Senate fails to override Obama's veto of Keystone XL approval
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Senate failed on Wednesday to override President Barack Obama's veto of legislation approving the Keystone XL oil pipeline  leaving the controversial project to await an administration decision on whether to permit or deny it.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. Senate fails to override Obama's veto of Keystone XL approval
column5: WASHINGTON  March 4 The U.S. Senate failed on Wednesday to override President Barack Obama's veto of legislation approving the Keystone XL oil pipeline  leaving the controversial project to await an administration decision on whether to permit or deny it.

column4: United Airlines may look to hedge fuel two years out
column5: United Continental Holdings Inc is looking to lock in its fuel costs with new hedges that could last as long as two years  but first it would like to see oil prices stabilize  Chief Financial Officer John Rainey said in an interview.

column4: Poland's No.1 web portal Wp.pl eyes $80.5 mln Warsaw IPO -report
column5: WARSAW  March 4 Poland's leading web portal  Wp.pl  plans to debut on the Warsaw bourse with an initial public offering (IPO) worth around 300 million zlotys ($80.5 million)  daily Puls Biznesu quoted its sources as saying.
